results.content: I appreciate the additional content for download which made the course easy to follow. However, I would have given it 5 stars except the last lesson didn't include the custom CSS. I looked for it in the downloads, the course Q&A, the course announcements, his YouTube channel, and his blog but they are nowhere to be found, so I wasn't able to complete the last lesson unless I wanted to input the code from the blurry video screens by hand. If you say it will be in your blog or in the comments of your video (I assume YouTube), then it SHOULD be there instead of wasting my time!
results.content_html: I appreciate the additional content for download which made the course easy to follow. However, I would have given it 5 stars except the last lesson didn't include the custom CSS. I looked for it in the downloads, the course Q&A, the course announcements, his YouTube channel, and his blog but they are nowhere to be found, so I wasn't able to complete the last lesson unless I wanted to input the code from the blurry video screens by hand. If you say it will be in your blog or in the comments of your video (I assume YouTube), then it SHOULD be there instead of wasting my time!

results.content:
Overall, an excellent course! I'm new to WP and Divi but a long-time web designer, primarily on Joomla with a strong technical background. The customization options were really good!

Really the only thing I wish was shown more was how to use pre-existing layouts. This was brushed on, but not really in depth. I do that to quickly put up a site and then customize as needed.
results.content_html:
Overall, an excellent course! I'm new to WP and Divi but a long-time web designer, primarily on Joomla with a strong technical background. The customization options were really good!

Really the only thing I wish was shown more was how to use pre-existing layouts. This was brushed on, but not really in depth. I do that to quickly put up a site and then customize as needed.

results.content:
Been working with Divi on an existing site.. had always learned just enough to problem solve/improve.

Darrel's introduction to the Divi Theme is perfect for the the way I prefer to learn. Starting with a blank page, and encouraging 'playing with the different options', showing similarities to other modules is unbelievably helpful.

The tutorials on the Elegant Themes website were okay, but I never got the big overall sense of what's similar, and how to quickly access the creative potential didn't seem to 'jump out at me', the way they do in this course.

AND - this course is free? So generous.

Thanks, Darrel!
results.content_html:
Been working with Divi on an existing site.. had always learned just enough to problem solve/improve.

Darrel's introduction to the Divi Theme is perfect for the the way I prefer to learn. Starting with a blank page, and encouraging 'playing with the different options', showing similarities to other modules is unbelievably helpful.

The tutorials on the Elegant Themes website were okay, but I never got the big overall sense of what's similar, and how to quickly access the creative potential didn't seem to 'jump out at me', the way they do in this course.

AND - this course is free? So generous.

Thanks, Darrel!

results.content:
This is a good Divi course, although it's not really a course. This is actually a 3-hour long tutorial that has been cropped to make different video files in order to sell it as a course.
The problem with this is, the titles of each section on Udemy don't correspond with what the video files talk about. For example, the section on "Creating the testimonials" doesn't actually contain information on creating testimonials, but the following section, "Creating the Footer", does. The same happens with most sections, it's as if the author was in a hurry when titling the different video files on Udemy and messed up their order.
Not just that, but the cropping of the different video files seems quite random. The videos often finish in the middle of a sentence, when the instructor has already started talking about the next topic.
To sum up, this is a good tutorial, but I think it lacks organization and it hasn't been converted into a course well.
results.content_html:
This is a good Divi course, although it's not really a course. This is actually a 3-hour long tutorial that has been cropped to make different video files in order to sell it as a course.
The problem with this is, the titles of each section on Udemy don't correspond with what the video files talk about. For example, the section on "Creating the testimonials" doesn't actually contain information on creating testimonials, but the following section, "Creating the Footer", does. The same happens with most sections, it's as if the author was in a hurry when titling the different video files on Udemy and messed up their order.
Not just that, but the cropping of the different video files seems quite random. The videos often finish in the middle of a sentence, when the instructor has already started talking about the next topic.
To sum up, this is a good tutorial, but I think it lacks organization and it hasn't been converted into a course well.

results.content:
It is completely a mind-boggling tutorial! Really, all the sessions have added entirely a new skill into my expertise.

Being into Digital Marketing, I'm now able to create my micro-website or personal blogs without relying on web designers & developers. One of my recent blogs, which I created after learning from this course, came out to be outstanding. I've already received good compliments on that.

One may check my blog design/layout at https://magneticefforts.com/

I personally would recommend this course to opt for, and in addition to that, also subscribe to Darrel Wilson's YouTube channel. One can't find such tremendous knowledge anywhere online.
